alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 6:34PM EST until February 16 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following county, Clinton. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albany, Cannons Mill, Bug, Upchurch, Snow, Wago, Browns Crossroads, Cartwright, Huntersville and Ida. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
